intro: Macroplethus spicatus, commonly known as the spicate macroplethus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and pairs of opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in warm climates.
